intro: Nemacaulis nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's nemacaulis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or greenish flowers bloom in clusters. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation to arid environments.
